channel.title: Sample on XploR Eos IDE
channel.description: Recent content in Sample on XploR Eos IDE

item.title: Managing Projects
item.description:
Managing Projects

Projects Overview

This section provides an overview of workspaces and projects and some features support users working more conveniently.

Workspaces

A “workspace” is the collection of one or more folders that are opened in the File Navigator. In most cases, a single folder is opened in the workspace. However, it is possible to have multiple folders open simultaneously, known as a multi-root workspace environment.

item.title: Building Projects
item.description:
Building Projects

Xplor Eos IDE supports building projects via the user interface. This section explains how to configure this feature to enhance your development workflow.

Build Configurations

A build configuration is the blueprint for compiling your project. The IDE automatically generates this configuration and stores it in a tasks.json file, located within the .theia folder in your workspace.

Build configurations in XploR Eos IDE function similarly to task configurations in VSCode. For a deeper understanding, refer to the Integrate with External Tools via Tasks documentation.

item.title: Debug Projects
item.description:
Debug Projects

Xplor IDE support for debug project currently in Xplorer, this section will guide you on how to start debug in Xplorer, for more complete information about debugging features, debugging steps as well as debug configuration, please see in Debug Project.

Launch Configurations

A launch configuration (or debug configuration) is used to set up the debugger when starting a debug session. The IDE typically auto-generates this information and stores it in a launch.json file within the .theia folder of your workspace.
